groups.title: Additions To Feather
changes: Feather now supports basic type narrowing using "object_index", "typeof", "instanceof", and the built-in "is_" functions. E.g. if (is_string(a) && typeof(b) == "number")
Changed Feather's tooltips to limit the number of struct fields if there are too many to show at once (and added a Preference for saying how many is "too many" for you)
Fixed some performance issues also

groups.title: Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
changes: Xbox GDK support updated to the "March 2022" version - you will need to change your SDK installation to match
Switch SDK support updated to version 14.3.0 - you will need to change your SDK installation to match

groups.title: Other Bugs Fixed
changes: Building Projects: [Xbox XDK YYC] Fixed an issue with the AppxManifest.xml file which could cause builds to fail when setting up title memory
Building Projects: [Xbox GDK] Fixed an issue with shaders not building correctly in recent Betas
Feather: Fixed incorrect determination and display of function signatures using argument array
Feather: All the "random..." functions are now correctly marked as being pure
Feather: Fixed that a number of functions which should handle scripts and custom functions only accepted scripts - e.g. layer_script_begin/end(), script_get_name(), and timeline_moment_add_script()
Feather: Similar to the above line, camera_get_begin/end/update_script() will all now return you the specific function being used, not just its entire script
Feather: Lots of "keyboard_..." functions will now also accept you passing in a real
Feather: asset_has_any_tag() now also accepts an array of strings
Feather: layer_instance_get_instance() now returns an instance, rather than a real
Feather: Dependency Walker incorrectly handles some edge cases, resulting in false GM1013 errors [partial fix, so the number of false-positives should now be lower]
Feather: Fixed some issues with "Globalvar" not resolving in the dependency walker [partial fix, so the number of false-positives should now be lower]
Feather: Overlapping tooltips can occur for autocomplete, JSDoc content, and rules [tooltips are now combined better and are also dismissed when clicking off them]
Feather: Unexpected "The identifier ... is declared as a local variable ... " error when reusing variable names in both instance and local scopes
Feather: Calling "draw_set_colour(c_white);" gives an incorrect GM2062 error
Feather: Fixed a null reference error which occurred when duplicating a function
Feather: Unexpected GM1056 errors when declaring optional arguments following an argument whose default is "undefined"
Feather: Fixed some issues with "Globalvar" not resolving in the dependency walker [partial fix, so the number of false-positives should now be lower]
Image Editor: GM hangs when adding text to a frame in 600 Betas
UI/UX: Closing a Workspace tab in a child window via MMB can cause gadgets in the main window to stop responding

groups.title: Removed Some Legacy Platforms/Architectures
changes: Some lesser-used or largely redundant versions of the targets have now been removed, so we can focus support on the current tools instead. These are:
Android x86 architecture (x86_64 is still there, so you can still use 64bit emulators)

UWP target has been removed entirely, as the Windows store has accepted native packages for a while and the GDK extension can be used to implement current versions of Microsoft’s social functionality	<li>Windows x86 (32bit support) architecture has been removed from Game Options, so now only 64bit executables are available
Xbox One Legacy (XDK) target has been removed entirely, as GDK has been available for a while

groups.title: Project Format Changes For Tile Layers In Rooms
changes: We have introduced a new, much faster method for storing tile data in your rooms and passing this information into your builds - which fixes a long-time issue where rooms with lots of tile slots could see a pause on the line "Found Project Format 2" in their output log
However, this new format is not compatible with older IDEs/runtimes and so accordingly we have introduced a new safeguard in this version, should you attempt to open a project in an older IDE again.
On opening the project in any version newer than 2022.6 GameMaker will raise the project version automatically to be 1.6

The next time a room containing a tile layer is edited in the newer IDE, this will potentially upgrade all the tile data and save it in a "TileCompressedData" variable in the room’s own .yyp file - at this point, this project cannot be loaded into previous IDEs as it won’t understand it. (The project would also lack all the tiles information if you used a current IDE but with a runtime from 2022.6 or older.)

Please note if the room wouldn't benefit from the compression, GameMaker will continue to store the data in the old-style "TileSerialiseData" variable - this is the same format as before and previous IDEs can open it if you need to; however, you will need to follow the steps in our FAQ for opening “too new” projects in older IDEs

groups.title: Additional Feather Functionality
changes: Naming Rules now have a new value of "Unconstrained", which you can set to tell Feather to allow any naming convention when dealing with certain aspects of your code

groups.title: Additional Extension Options Functionality
changes: Added combobox gadget support into the extension options editor and also the ability to mark settings as hidden to the “user-facing” extension options
Added support for native-language Android/iOS extensions to access your extension options values, as set in the IDE

groups.title: Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
changes: Building Projects: Sound assets with invalid or non-existent underlying files are still embedded in the game, should error instead  [now you will be asked to fix problem sounds before the build will succeed - note that those sounds would not have worked correctly in-game in previous releases, and our only change here is that you were not told this]

Feather: Macros with Configs do not rewrite correctly
Feather: Multiple issues with interpreting arrays or structs created from passing an array into "new"
Feather: Output log fills up with "Unable find function 'ent_player_Event_Create$$anon_function ...', which should exist!", slowing the IDE
Feather: Parameters only keep their type as "Any" until one with a default value is used, should always follow their JSDoc values and warn when mismatch detected
Feather: Prefix operators following a semicolon are incorrectly parsed as ";++"
Feather: Quick Fix to generate JSDoc mangles documentation in various ways
Feather: Quick Fixes do not appear inside of function bodies
Feather: Reassigning a macro to be an anonymous function created by "new" results in type-inference breaking
Feather: Rendering tooltips of enums with too many members does not fit into the IDE window
Feather: Repeated "unable to find function" messages shown in output after declaring a method variable
Feather: Unexpected "Error Rewriting" for GM2001 when nested parentheses are used
Feather: Suggestion GM2061 is raised even if the condition has an else branch
Feather: Syntax highlighting for tooltips isn't correct
Feather: Tooltips do not display for dereferenced variables of type 'Any'
Feather: Tooltips do not display in deeply nested functions
Feather: Tooltips for global variables should display the "global." prefix
Feather: Type of arg[0]() is incorrectly inferred as Function instead of Array(Function)
Feather: Type of argument[i] is incorrectly determined
Feather: Unmatched curly braces do not raise an error
Feather: layer_enable_fx() second argument is treated as "undefined", so gives unexpected warnings
Feather: sprite_index and mask_index are treated as not allowing -1 as a valid assignment
File Watcher: [Mac IDE] Should ignore any .DS_Store files which appear in the save location on disk, rather than adding them into the project .yyp
Game Options: [Opera GX] Deleted games still show in your Game List
GXC Integration: Game uploads fail if the Game Options "Game Name" value contains an underscore (and some other special characters)
Inspector: [Animation Curve] Unable to paste a copied curve
Inspector: [Font] Turns blank after regenerating a font texture when all glyphs are selected
Localisation: Redefine Keys' "Delete" entry is not localised for Japanese
Localisation: References to "Drag and Drop" (rather than "GML Visual") can still be found in some strings
Localisation: Update IDE translations to account for changes in 2022.6
Marketplace Integration: [Light skin] Asset Import dialog text turns invisible when an item is selected
Preferences: General's "IDE Font" label is not translated, is always English
Preferences: JetBrains font uses a replacement font for Chinese glyphs, but the other font is not refreshed when JetBrains selected, gives missing characters inside GM
Preferences: [Ubuntu IDE] Android SDK/NDK/JDK fields do not accept paths chosen in picker, require editing via keyboard
Project Import: [Mac IDE] 2022.6 cannot import GM 2.2.5-and-older projects
Project Load: [Mac IDE] Cannot open projects direct from Finder via their .yyp file / Project Load: [Mac IDE] Right-clicking .yyp files and "open with" shows Start Page, not the Import dialog
Room Editor: GM crashes (on certain monitors) when opening room creation code if the currently-selected layer is a filter layer
Room Editor: GM crashes when scrolling enough that the room goes off-screen whilst a filter layer is being previewed
Room Editor: Rename filter layer "Rgb1/2/3" parameters to specify which one of R, G or B that setting actually affects
Room Editor: Windblown Particle Effect settings are not localised, always use English
UI/UX: [Mac IDE] Laptop status is always set to false, so Macbooks do not use the expected hotkeys in some cases
UI/UX: [Mac IDE] Touchpad scrolling no longer uses the OS's "inertia" value
UI/UX: [Ubuntu IDE] Update libGTK 2 linkage to use libGTK 3 instead
Workspaces: [Vulkan] Performance drops after dragging a workspace out to be a new child window multiple times whilst a room is opened

groups.title: Removed Some Legacy Platforms/Architectures
changes: Some lesser-used or largely redundant versions of the targets have now been removed, so we can focus support on the current tools instead. These are:
Android x86 architecture (x86_64 is still there, so you can still use 64bit emulators)

UWP target has been removed entirely, as the Windows store has accepted native packages for a while and the GDK extension can be used to implement current versions of Microsoft’s social functionality	<li>Windows x86 (32bit support) architecture has been removed from Game Options, so now only 64bit executables are available
Xbox One Legacy (XDK) target has been removed entirely, as GDK has been available for a while

groups.title: Project Format Changes For Tile Layers In Rooms
changes: We have introduced a new, much faster method for storing tile data in your rooms and passing this information into your builds - which fixes a long-time issue where rooms with lots of tile slots could see a pause on the line "Found Project Format 2" in their output log
However, this new format is not compatible with older IDEs/runtimes and so accordingly we have introduced a new safeguard in this version, should you attempt to open a project in an older IDE again.
On opening the project in any version newer than 2022.6 GameMaker will raise the project version automatically to be 1.6

The next time a room containing a tile layer is edited in the newer IDE, this will potentially upgrade all the tile data and save it in a "TileCompressedData" variable in the room’s own .yyp file - at this point, this project cannot be loaded into previous IDEs as it won’t understand it. (The project would also lack all the tiles information if you used a current IDE but with a runtime from 2022.6 or older.)

Please note if the room wouldn't benefit from the compression, GameMaker will continue to store the data in the old-style "TileSerialiseData" variable - this is the same format as before and previous IDEs can open it if you need to; however, you will need to follow the steps in our FAQ for opening “too new” projects in older IDEs

groups.title: Additional Feather Functionality
changes: Naming Rules now have a new value of "Unconstrained", which you can set to tell Feather to allow any naming convention when dealing with certain aspects of your code

groups.title: Additional Extension Options Functionality
changes: Added combobox gadget support into the extension options editor and also the ability to mark settings as hidden to the “user-facing” extension options
Added support for native-language Android/iOS extensions to access your extension options values, as set in the IDE

groups.title: Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
changes: Building Projects: Sound assets with invalid or non-existent underlying files are still embedded in the game, should error instead  [now you will be asked to fix problem sounds before the build will succeed - note that those sounds would not have worked correctly in-game in previous releases, and our only change here is that you were not told this]

groups.title: Other Bugs Fixed
changes: Asset Browser: Unable to delete multiple Tags at once in Quick Access
Building Projects: Clean up "hobby subscription" code and remove associated splash screens from the runtimes
Building Projects: Compiler hangs for a minute or more on "Found Project Format 2" on attached project
Building Projects: Switch builds no longer contain the IDE version number in their metadata, can cause submission fails
Building Projects: Texture pages are being re-written every run in 2022.6.0, causing long build times
Building Projects: Ubuntu IDE cannot build Android YYC for projects with extensions
Building Projects: [HTML5] Global-scope macros which call in-built variables will cause a build error
Building Projects: [Mac IDE] Building archives for iOS and tvOS will not show Xcode Organiser on completion

groups.title: Removed Some Legacy Platforms/Architectures
changes: Some lesser-used or largely redundant versions of the targets have now been removed, so we can focus support on the current tools instead. These are:
Android x86 architecture (x86_64 is still there, so you can still use 64bit emulators)

UWP target has been removed entirely, as the Windows store has accepted native packages for a while and the GDK extension can be used to implement current versions of Microsoft’s social functionality	<li>Windows x86 (32bit support) architecture has been removed from Game Options, so now only 64bit executables are available
Xbox One Legacy (XDK) target has been removed entirely, as GDK has been available for a while

groups.title: Project Format Changes For Tile Layers In Rooms
changes: We have introduced a new, much faster method for storing tile data in your rooms and passing this information into your builds - which fixes a long-time issue where rooms with lots of tile slots could see a pause on the line "Found Project Format 2" in their output log
However, this new format is not compatible with older IDEs/runtimes and so accordingly we have introduced a new safeguard in this version, should you attempt to open a project in an older IDE again.
On opening the project in any version newer than 2022.6 GameMaker will raise the project version automatically to be 1.6

The next time a room containing a tile layer is edited in the newer IDE, this will potentially upgrade all the tile data and save it in a "TileCompressedData" variable in the room’s own .yyp file - at this point, this project cannot be loaded into previous IDEs as it won’t understand it. (The project would also lack all the tiles information if you used a current IDE but with a runtime from 2022.6 or older.)

Please note if the room wouldn't benefit from the compression, GameMaker will continue to store the data in the old-style "TileSerialiseData" variable - this is the same format as before and previous IDEs can open it if you need to; however, you will need to follow the steps in our FAQ for opening “too new” projects in older IDEs

groups.title: Additional Feather Functionality
changes: New functions and a rollback event have been added for providing chat functionality to your players
New Visual nodes have been added for the above, plus some others which were missing from earlier Betas - and Toolbox icons have been fixed for the existing rollback nodes

groups.title: Additional Feather Functionality
changes: Naming Rules now have a new value of "Unconstrained", which you can set to tell Feather to allow any naming convention when dealing with certain aspects of your code

groups.title: Additional Extension Options Functionality
changes: Added combobox gadget support into the extension options editor and also the ability to mark settings as hidden to the “user-facing” extension options
Added support for native-language Android/iOS extensions to access your extension options values, as set in the IDE

groups.title: Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
changes: Building Projects: Sound assets with invalid or non-existent underlying files are still embedded in the game, should error instead  [now you will be asked to fix problem sounds before the build will succeed - note that those sounds would not have worked correctly in-game in previous releases, and our only change here is that you were not told this]

groups.title: Resource Refactor
changes: This beta introduces a big clean up that should have very minor impact on the usage but will make future updates far more stable
There may be minor changes to the file format of some resources

groups.title: Resource Refactor
changes: This beta introduces a big clean up that should have very minor impact on the usage but will make future updates far more stable
There may be minor changes to the file format of some resources

groups.title: Added Opera GX Game Options SSO Account Label
changes: In previous releases there was no indication/error given if a game registration failed because you were actually logged-in as a different SSO account in your browser to the one you had logged-into GM with

Now, Game Options tells you which account GameMaker will use to register/upload your games to (or if you're not actually logged-in yet), so you can more easily see when there is an upload fail due to a simple account mismatch
Note: if you do happen to use multiple Opera accounts, then you should continue to make sure your web browser is signed-in to the one you need before doing any uploads

groups.title: Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
changes: Added support for Android's "ProGuard" minifying and shrinking options - you can now enable these in Game Options if you wish (defaults to off) and the corresponding steps will then be performed during your builds
Also added $YYAndroidProguard as a tag so that your extensions can inject into the proguard.pro file

groups.title: Other Bugs Fixed
changes: Asset Browser: GM crashes when duplicating a sprite in some 800 Betas
Building Projects: [YYC] Builds fail if struct member names are strings containing spaces
Building Projects: [macOS] Fixed an issue where some special characters (such as apostrophes and brackets) were not escaped properly and so caused builds to fail
Code Editor (Visual): Typing "x" and "y" in instance creation code editors will also modify its Flip X/Y values in the room

Note that there were actual several ways in which Room Editor commands could be accidentally triggered when typing in GML Visual editors which were open over the top of the room, and the fix above should resolve all of them
GXC Integration: GM silently fails to register a new game on gx.games if browser account differs from IDE account [see the Game Options mention higher up]
Room Editor: GM unstable when attempting to paste an instance into the room in some 800 Betas / Room Editor: Copy-and-pasting assets results in an empty asset in some 800 Betas
Sequence Editor: Removed a redundant "Asset Track" variable from sequence instances
UI/UX: [Mac IDE] Dock icon "Quit" option doesn't actually close GM

groups.title: More Fixes/Performance Changes For Feather
changes: Feather now does its parsing work on a separate application thread, so projects will load more quickly and should no longer cause "stalls"/"freezes" as you edit your projects
Fixed a number of threading errors/crashes by making the change above
You should also now find documents are fully code-coloured much more quickly after opening

groups.title: Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
changes: Room Editor: Fixed that duplicating a layer did not preserve all of its instance's creation code on the new layer you made and so you had to copy the code manually later

Fixed some memory management around loading assets, will stop potential leaks and also fixes an issue with breakpoints failing to stay on the correct line in Object events if you later add other lines higher up in your code

groups.title: Other Bugs Fixed
changes: Building Projects: [Android] 800 Betas are frequently unable to clean the project cache because path names are > 260 chars [previously it said that a number of "jar_..." folders were locked]
Device Manager: [Switch] "Test Connection" for a blank device always shows as successful [also did not detect EDEV devices because they are USB only - these will now be found properly]

Game Options: [PS5] Removed redundant options which are not actually used during builds (for the most part because they now come from your game metadata anyway) - Version number, Package ID, NPTitleID, NPTitleSecret, Share Param File, Pronunciation File, and Pronunciation Sig
Inspector: Sound waveform/preview pane is missing in 800 Betas
Timeline Editor: Duplicated moments are not being parsed after they are created
UI/UX: Tab and Shift+Tab no longer move between dialog fields in 800 Betas

Building Projects: [macOS] Building a DMG always fails in 800 Betas, as looking for the wrong filename [needs the matching new runtime also]
Code Editor: F1/MMB no longer opens the selected Asset in 800 Betas
Config Editor: Multiple editors can be opened at once, can lead to incorrect values saved
Debugger: Display actual instance IDs and object type rather than raw references
Feather: Unexpected Error GM1013 when using a function declared inside another function
Feather: Does not handle comparing shader_current to -1 (only allows asset.GMShader type)
Feather: GM unstable when double-clicking on an error for a function located in an extension
Feather: Using a valid accessor on read-only variables should not raise errors GM2016, GM1008, or GM1031
Feather: Expressions using accessors sometimes give unexpected type error as if the accessor was not being used
Feather: Enum types specified in JSDoc for parameters are not respected thereafter
Feather: GM unstable when enabling Feather if a project already loaded
Feather: The "Syntax Errors" window which appears when Feather is disabled is always undocked

Project Load: GM crashes when reopening a project after resizing any font in that project which lacks standard chars the IDE expects [GM now calculates the initial size much more accurately for fonts which lack these standard characters and will also resize the texture page correctly when you increase the font's point size]
UI/UX: Reset Layout menubar command will no longer create duplicate "Syntax Errors" or "Compiler Errors" windows
UI/UX: Collapsed "Output Windows" do not always show contents when expanded, have to interact with the window manually to trigger

groups.title: Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
changes: Fixed a very important project-saving bug where if a script's source file had become locked (e.g., by an external process such as source control or Dropbox/GDrive/OneDrive, etc.) and therefore wasn't able to be read, then it was possible that Feather would incorrectly cause some other assets to be lost (typically Scripts, but not limited to this)

The font used for Chinese in the Mac IDE has now been changed, as the one we used is no longer included by Apple in recent macOS versions and so this could cause a number of issues when trying to draw font characters

groups.title: Other Bugs Fixed
changes: Asset Browser: All child rooms created from the same source have the same name
Asset Browser: The Asset Browser is not updating after deleting a child room
Code Editor (Visual): "String not found: GMStdGain" now shown on Play Audio node in 800 Betas
Feather: Re-enabling Feather in a project shows 0 messages for all three categories
Feather: Feather Messages incorrectly report 0 issues of specific type when filtered
Feather: Errors in timeline scripts show a red cross image in the Feather Messages "Resource" column, rather than a proper icon
Feather: Does not open any Timeline assets when double-clicking their Messages panel entries
Feather: Messages panel highlight/selection becomes offset from the mouse cursor when scrolling through lots of messages
Feather: GM unstable when returning to the Start Page after running project CameraTo...

Go To: GM can crash when using search asset function if results failed to appear and so Go To is manually reopened repeatedly in an attempt to refresh the list [Note that we have stopped the crash and you will now get an error message if GM thinks there are any missing results - please send us your ui.log in a bug report if you see this]
Preferences: [Mac IDE] Unable to bring up the context menu inside of editors when IDE language is set to "Simplified Chinese"
Project Save/Load: Other files are locked and incorrectly lost after renaming a script in the project attached [see the important note higher up]
Room Editor: Background layer sprite and colour properties do not update in the window according to inheritance
Startup: [Mac IDE] GM crashes on launch when the IDE language is set to "Simplified Chinese"
Startup: IDE and WebServer frequently leave multiple orphan processes when 800 Betas are closed

groups.title: Other Bugs Fixed
changes: Feather: Message underlines shift around when writing code in late Aug22 Betas
Feather: Refactoring is causing macros to be converted to their values in the code editor
Project Save: GM hangs for some users when renaming a script, file watcher is triggered also

groups.title: Restored Some Missing Fixes
changes: Project loading will now also merge duplicate folders whenever they are detected in a .yyp file - so if you had a project which for some reason had gained duplicate folders in the Asset Browser, you should now find that simply opening the project in this version will clean that up (if you know that you have a project in this state it’s worth creating a backup before you open it, so that if you do have any issues you can send us the original version for investigation)
Asset Browser: Moving a folder of assets into another folder will cause resource load failures
Project Load: Room Editor background layer colour values are no longer reset to white when loading a project
Project Save: GM no longer hangs for some users when renaming a script (stops unexpected File Watcher dialogs also) [a final part of this fix had been lost in 34]

groups.title: New Fixes
changes: Project Load: Room Order groups are no longer removed when loading a project

groups.title: Default Project Layout
changes: The default project layout now includes the Inspector and no longer includes Recent Windows
Inspector (by default) will sit on the left hand side of the workspace but it is freely movable and dockable
Though the Inspector has been around for a long time now, we are bringing it to the front
Your current layout in your project is unaffected by this change
The Layout -> Reset Layout drop down menu option will reset to this new layout scheme. So use Save Layout if you want to keep your current setup
Recent Windows can still be opened from the Windows drop down menu

groups.title: Room Inspector and Room Editor
changes: The Room Inspector is how you will now access many of the settings for rooms
Before all the settings and layers were cramped into a single panel
Layers are now their own dockable panel that sits separate from the settings
Layer Settings, Physics, Viewports and Cameras, Room Size and Creation Code settings are now all part of the inspector exclusively

groups.title: Bugs Fixed
changes: Audio Groups: [Mac IDE] The option "move to" is very close to the arrow/ off centre
Bookmarks: If a line of code/ action block within a script is bookmarked, it will reopen its own workspace tab if accessed again
Code Editor: Hovering over "Add new event" and then "Single Pane" will close the context menu
Code Editor: Pre-2022.8 project layouts containing open code editors expand all folded code and lose the ability to code fold until closed and reopened manually
Debugger: [Mac IDE] Fullscreen IDEs opening windowed debuggers restored from a layout file result in a fullscreen debugger window with black bars to fill the gaps
Device Manager: [Mac IDE] "Detect Browsers" detects Opera GX as "Opera", blocking it from opening for HTML5 builds
Feather: Errors in timeline scripts show a red cross image in the Feather Messages Resource column
Feather: Cannot open timeline resources from the Feather Messages window
Image Editor: Sat/Val values are automatically rounded down when modifying the other value
Image Editor: [Mac IDE] Holding "CTRL" whilst using the Paint Selection Tool does not add to the selection
Inspector [Room Instance] : Inspector changes focus to the wrong element when clicking on "Open Editor" on an instance in a room
Inspector [Room Instance] : Sequence preview in Canvas does not update when changed via the Inspector
Inspector: [Mac IDE] A room's Instance Layer's "Instances" list overlaps the entries
Marketplace Integration: [Mac IDE] Asset description is clipped at the end
Project Saving: [Windows IDE] No dialog shown to users when unable to rename assets because filepath is too long
Room Editor [Tile Layer]: Tileset Editor does not open when editing Libraries from the Room Editor
Room Editor: Creation Code window initially opens to incorrect size
Search and Replace: Double-clicking on a search result will not scroll to the correct part of the code editor
Sequence Editor : Animation Curve rendered incomplete
Start Up: Fatal exception on exiting the IDE during a splash screen
Start Up: Some users unable to download runtimes due to error "System.IO.IOException: The response ended prematurely..."

groups.title: Misc Other Changes To Be Aware Of
changes: Web Server now stops if the IDE is closed

changes: Animation Curve: Deleting all curves then closing modal, cannot open curve

changes: Web Server now stops if the IDE is closed

groups.title: ”Opera GX” Target Rebranded As “GX.games”
changes: The target has always been part of a whole ecosystem of releasing your games on the GX.games site and sharing them with others (for free or as paid content), so this new name clarifies that

If you have not had a look at GX.games and what it offers, please do check it out and play a few games, see if it’s a route you would like to take also
  • You already have access to publish games on it (for free) as part of your Opera Account and you can also see our tutorial about what publishing on GX.games involves if you want more info

groups.title: Additional Changes For Texture Group Management
changes: Added ability to get process memory on Windows
Stripped the auto-generated texture groups from the texture group debug display

groups.title: Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
changes: Licensing: Opera Account users who have never logged-in on the website would see an unhelpful "UID not present" error message in previous releases - this is now the correct "Please complete your profile" message

groups.title: Bugs Fixed
changes: Code Editor: skeleton_skin_create() isn't highlighted as an in-built function (Feather or not)
Feather: Variables declared in Variable Definitions return an error when used outside the Create event
Feather: Renaming a function refactors all calls to that function, but not the function definition line [partial fix so far]
Feather: GM hang when the Rename Identifier window is closed after doing a rename operation
Feather: Rename identifier & Go To Issue does not work when the Inspector is open
Room Editor: GM unstable when adding effect layer to new room if the entire room is panned off-screen at the time
Target Manager: Change the default target for free users to be "GX.games" (same as everyone else already has)

groups.title: Bugs Fixed
changes: Redefine Keys: More fixes for "String not found: RedefineKeys_...Tool" shown for multiple commands in the Preferences window
Redefine Keys: Sequence Editor and Font Editor are no longer missing from the list of commands
Redefine Keys: Fixed an issue where pressing Ctrl+D in the Font Editor would not actually perform the "Delete selected range" command (only affected Windows IDE)
Room Editor: Added a check when opening a room to ensure there is always an Inspector open and that it contains the Room Layers panel

groups.title: Runtime Modules Dialog
changes: GameMaker now handles downloading just the specific modules you request from a runtime - you will see a new dialog for this the first time you start this new version
You can select a minimal install suitable for your current OS, whichever modules you require just now, or “just give me everything” (which is what GameMaker has always done until now)
For more information on this dialog and how to use it, please see our new FAQ all about it

groups.title: Misc Other Changes To Be Aware Of
changes: Sequence Editor: It was never really exposed in the IDE, but there was a WIP asset track available in-game - this has now been removed, as the full in-game implementation was never done, and so if you were using this “hidden” track in your games you will now need to change your code accordingly

Localisation: Our language csv files have now been updated to conform to RFC 4180 standard (and therefore escape special characters) - whilst you may not need to make any changes in your custom setups, you should be aware of this if you’re editing ours or making your own localisation spreadsheets from scratch

groups.title: Bugs Fixed
changes: Asset Browser: Room Manager "Collapse All" context menu command does not work unless you clicked in empty space
Building Projects: Unable to build a project when using a Sprite with Nine Slice enabled as a Background layer, shows incorrect error message
Building Projects: post_texture scripts are not being run when targeting platforms other than Windows
Building Projects: [Android] Injection of IronSource's recommended ProGuard values creates an invalid ProGuard file, as an unwanted "methods" closing tag appears
Building Projects: [GDK] Add a stage to precompile the shaders
Building Projects: [HTML5] Attempting to re-run a project when one is still running only asks user to cancel one time
Building Projects: [HTML5] Clicking the 'Stop' button to end a running project displays 'FAILED: Run Program Complete' in the output window
Building Projects: [HTML5] Projects which contain the "JuJu Libraries" extension and other extensions can fail to find some of the extensions later on
Building Projects: [macOS] Unable to build YYC from Windows for certain projects due to incorrect App ID being sent
Code Editor (Visual): Add nodes for new get/set/use rollback player preferences functions
Code Editor (Visual): In multicolumn layout, using arrow keys will affect all columns instead of just the selected one
Crash Reporter: Occasionally triggered on startup when there's no record of a crash in the log and user was unaware of any issue
Feather: Local variable definitions incorrectly flag GM2043 in some circumstances

Game Options: [PS5] Remove redundant options which are not actually used during builds  [the UI for these was removed in 2022.8, but creating a new project still wrote the default values to the .yyp, so those are removed now also]
Go To: Feather's Preferences don't appear in search results
Inspector: Cannot click on an already-selected item within a multi-select list to deselect it
Inspector: [Font] [Mac IDE] Tags field cuts off the bottoms of some characters
Inspector: [Room Instance] Copy and pasting an instance with creation code will not show the code in Inspector until you deselect and reselect the instance
Inspector: [Sequence] Opacity and Offset controls for images should be disabled when no image has been selected
Local Packages: Importing single objects from a package loses its parent value, even though an object with the parent's name already exists
Local Packages: Selecting to import only a room from a package does not fully account for assets referenced in the room, can also make GM unstable if reusing an existing room's name
Object Editor: Assets can no longer be dragged onto the Variable Definitions window pickers to set "Asset"-type values
Preferences: "Resources" name used instead of "assets" in General Settings
Preferences: Anti-aliasing radio buttons shift left after hovering over them
Preferences: Feather section is not localised
Project Export: Root-level compile scripts are not included in .yyz packages
Project Import: If the .yyz name contains additional dots, then GM suggests an incomplete save name
Project Save: Redundant warning when renaming newly-created and empty Timeline moments
Room Editor: Add indicator to the Layers Panel to show when a filter/effect has been used on a layer
Room Editor: Layers which previously inherited from other rooms keep showing the "inherited" status after the parent room is removed
Room Editor: Paths can't be modified when "select from any layer" is enabled
Room Editor: Tile Layer panel's preview icon for the tileset is no longer visible in 2022.9
Sprite Editor: [Spine] Unable to import images which have multiple skins using Spine's mesh-deformation feature
Start Page: Downloading any Templates will not immediately recreate the TemplateFiles cache folder if it is missing, causes loading errors
Start Page: Folder picker button missing hover highlight
Start Page: Modify tour/wizard to start new users on step 2
Startup: Failing to find a runtime feed shows 2 error dialogs and duplicates the error string on the splash screen
Startup: GM crash when clicking other buttons too quickly after "Ignore this version"
Startup: Logging in using SSO causes a machine.General Settings.Environment.Environment error in the ui.log
Tile Set Editor: Auto-tiling brush-builder and animations library panels' preview icon for the tileset is no longer visible in 2022.9
UI/UX: Mouse wheel input continues scrolling the initial dialog for too long after the cursor has been moved over another scrollable panel

groups.title: Pinch To Zoom
changes: The Workspace can now be zoomed in and out on devices with touch inputs like trackpads
This is available for both Mac and Windows IDE
There is a preference to disable this feature if desired

groups.title: Paste image as a layer
changes: The Image Editor will now allow you to paste from clipboard to a new layer
The new layer will be above the currently selected layer and the pan tool will be selected to allow you to control the pasted content
The old style Paste-As-Brush can be enabled in preferences

groups.title: Implement a Case-insensitive Compatibility Mode for macOS/Linux
changes: There has been an ongoing issue with case-sensitivity when working across different platforms and changing an Assets case when renaming
An option has been added to allow you to disable this as it is quite performance heavy

groups.title: Other Bugs Fixed
changes: Asset Browser: Wrong message when renaming a group the same as another group in the same location
Feather: Variable Definitions used in the matching event for both parent and child object will get a Warning GM2016 message
Install: [Runtime Modules] "Remember Selections" box is re-enabled each time the dialog appears, does not remember user choice
Startup : Redundant copyright information on loading screen
Workspaces: Alt button causes gadgets to lose focus
